2.text:
If you've never crossed the
Atlantic, you might not realize

4.text: that there's quite a few things

5.text: that we do differently over here,

7.text:
so here are 30 things that
every American should know

14.text: We have a lot less obese people.

20.text: but we do still call these fries.

23.text:
This is how the British
eat with a knife and fork.

26.text: We use roundabouts instead of stop signs

28.text: because they're a lot more efficient

30.text: because you don't have to stop moving.

33.text:
Instead of saying bathroom
or restroom or services,

36.text: we usually say, "We're going to the toilet

39.text:
We don't take it literally,
so it's not rude for us.

42.text: Lemonade is pretty much always fizzy here.

44.text:
We call pudding pudding, but
we also call cake pudding

48.text: Pretty much any dessert is pudding.

54.text:
and they go pretty much
all over the country.

57.text:
The London Underground is
complicated, sweaty, and gross

61.text:
and the chute drivers go
on strike every other week,

63.text:
but without it, we wouldn't be
able to get around in London.

65.text:
If you're over 60, you
get free rail, bus, and TV

69.text:
and discounts on pretty
much everything else.

71.text:
Cheers means thanks and
people use it all the time,

74.text: not just when they're at the pub.

79.text:
but you can buy alcohol from
a shop through the night.

81.text:
You can drink on the streets
with an open container.

85.text:
Every other word is
please, thanks, or cheers.

89.text:
Our bathroom light switch
is a piece of string

91.text: like a cord, bing boom, just like that.

94.text: A fanny is not what you think it is.

99.text:
We do have speed cameras,
but before you get to it,

102.text:
there'll be about 10
different warning signs

105.text: so you pretty much can't miss them.

107.text:
There's no AC in summer,
like no one has AC.

111.text: University used to be free in England.

113.text:
It's not anymore, but it's
still a hell of a lot cheaper

115.text:
than it is is America, and
it is still free in Scotland.

119.text:
We have less TV adverts than
you, and they're less annoying,

121.text:
but people still hate them
and still fast forward

125.text:
We don't do specialty
biz nails as well as you.

129.text:
We have free healthcare,
but a lot of people moan

132.text:
I mean, we do still pay for
it out of our paychecks.

135.text:
The vast majority of coffee
that people drink at home

137.text: is this horrible powdered instant crap,

142.text: for bringing it over during World War Two.

146.text:
We have buildings that
are over 5,000 years old.

152.text:
We call these pants, and
we call these trousers.

155.text:
Oh, and we call a sweater a
jumper but also a sweater too.

158.text:
Our power outlets have
switches, pretty useful.

162.text: This is a biscuit, and this is a cookie,

165.text:
but this is not a biscuit
and this is not a cookie.

168.text:
We call an eraser a rubber,
and no we don't use the word

170.text: rubber for a condom like you guys.

175.text: All high street prices include tax.

177.text:
We don't show it separately
because everyone pays it,

181.text:
Most of our newspapers are
terrible and filled with crap,

185.text:
Hopefully, you've learned a
thing or two from this video,

187.text:
and now you will be
prepared for the next time

189.text: that you come over to England.

190.text: If you did enjoy this video,

191.text: do please give it a thumbs up

194.text: if you're not already a regular viewer

196.text:
by going down and hitting that
red subscribe button below

198.text:
so that you don't miss out
on future videos I make.

200.text:
But otherwise, thanks
very much for watching

202.text: and I'll see you again soon.
